metadata.titel_preek: Seeing Sin as God Sees It—Psalm 51

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God creates a new heart and restores the sinner by taking the judgment upon Himself in Christ, enabling a confession that is not driven by fear but by the prior knowledge of grace.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself
Jesus... has voluntarily taken our place
God made him to be sin

object.identificatie: The restoration/re-creation of the human person (A clean heart/Righteousness)
tekstueel_bewijs: make a new person out of the sinner
Create in me a clean heart

zender.identificatie: God as the Holy One/Author of Goodness
tekstueel_bewijs: the reality and power and holiness of the living God
us to come to terms with ourselves
we might become the righteousness of God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Knowledge of Grace
tekstueel_bewijs: The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession
Jesus... bearing in his own body the storm
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (Mediator)

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Satan, and the 'Lies to ourselves'
tekstueel_bewijs: storm of the wrath of God
imperviousness to the unpleasantness of self-knowledge
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the 'storm of wrath', 'Satan', and 'Death', requiring a divine substitute.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and liturgical penitence.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (confession) is explicitly stated to be the *result* of the primary program (God's grace).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Holy God → Righteousness/New Heart → Community of Sinners

voorbeelden_god_subject: God made him to be sin.
God is truly able to overcome sin.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We lie to others and ourselves.

voorbeelden: day set aside... for us to come to terms
what they want is the confession
learned to see sin as God sees it
only power than can overcome sin
God is truly able to overcome sin

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that humans lack the 'Pouvoir' (power) to see or fix themselves; this power is granted through the 'Savoir' (revelation) of God's grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Pretense) to S2 (Judgment/Wrath) to S1 (Grace) via Christ taking S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary Atonement: Christ occupies S2 so the sinner can move to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; described as a 'storm' and 'wrath' that leaves one 'naked'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects moralism by stating that the recognition of sin is the *result* of grace, not the condition for it. God is the primary actor in the 'new creation'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It takes maturity, wisdom, and true manliness to offer a handsome apology.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is used not as a hero to emulate, but as a 'masterpiece' of the human condition in receipt of grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who justifies the David who has no excuses.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting charade' of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by faith alone; the hearer is passive in salvation and active only in the response of worship.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the human need for confession to the divine provision of Christ is perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Against you only have I sinned' and the reality of human victims.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Son, with the Spirit's work implied in 'Create in me a clean heart'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'storm' and a 'sentence of death' that humans cannot escape by effort.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's initiative. The human 'Subject' only appears in the secondary program of response.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon already does this well.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a textbook example of a grace-oriented sermon where the actantial structure perfectly mirrors the theological content.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the O.J. Simpson anecdote, Greimas reveals that the anecdote serves to establish the 'Lack' which only the Divine Subject can fill.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Psalm 51; semiotics shows how the preacher re-actualizes the Psalm's 'Subject' (God) for the modern 'Receiver' (Congregation).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Subject' of the active verbs of salvation remains God even when the sermon discusses human confession.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'if-then' trap of moralism.
